title: 6.0   Going downhill, sadly. Not up to 5 stars!
review: This is an historic building in a wonderful mountain setting. The food is excellent, with large portions and the restaurant has great views during daylight hours. There is a built-in music system in the lounge, bathroom & bedroom, which is a lovely touch. The sound quality is good too. The bed is comfortable. There is a log fire in the lounge, which is ready for you to light, if it gets cold. The scenery is wonderful and the location very good for visiting Antequera, The Torcals & Lobo Parque. The male receptionist was poor on our arrival, and was not friendly or welcoming. However, the lady on our departure was very friendly. There was a long wait for the bar steward, who eventually turned up, got us 2 drinks, then quickly disappeared. The waiter service was very poor on our 2nd night, forgetting our bread, appetizers & to light our candle. They too were not friendly. As a light bulb was not working in our room, I fetched one from reception & put it in myself. This is supposed to be a five star hotel. Why do the maids never check if all of the lighting works? All of the lampshades were burnt, due to having the wrong bulbs in them. The restaurant did not open on time, so I sat down, and the arm fell off the chair! The Wi-Fi was patchy, dropping out occasionally. The toilet paper is disgustingly thin and cheap. There was no free water or chocolate or turn down service. We booked a double bed, but got 2 x single beds, made up separately, and pushed together! The sound insulation is very poor. You can hear people walking, moving etc. very clearly.…

title: Great place
review: Dear LuxuryExplorer01 ,  Your vision is the key to complete the satisfaction of our guests, and we are very grateful for your valuable time in leaving your comment on Tripadvisor. We regret your disappointment. All rooms are checked at the cleaning and maintenance level to ensure that everything works properly and if any anomaly is found, report to the corresponding department for repair. It is clear that on this occasion we have not acted as usual and we regret not having been informed at the reception in order to intervene so that you could have fully enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We have taken note regarding your comments of attention to the public and service by our staff so that it does not happen again.  We would like to welcome you again in the future, ensuring in advance our maximum commitment to make your next vacation experience at the Convento La Magdalena Hotel something unforgettable in every way.  Sincerely, Customer Support.

title: Slightly disappointing experience
review: The hotel is older and a bit tired but still a great place to stay in Antequera, Spain.  The room was large and clean. They had a room service menu but when we went to order our lunch we were told there was no cook - so we ate the chips from the minibar!! The dinner was fabulous - one of our favourites so far - the artichoke hearts and octopus were amazing!!  Highly recommended!

title: Great getaway
review: Dear 508lynnl,  Thank you very much for taking the time to provide feedback concerning your recent visit at Hotel Convento La Magdalena. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we are determined to ensure that all of our guests have a rewarding stay.  Once again, thank you for your kind comments, and we hope to have soon the opportunity to welcome you back in our hotel.  Warm Regards

title: Dinner
review: From the exterior ‘tis hotel looked fantastic. However once we got in the experience was slightly less grand. Overall the hotel lacked atmosphere and was rather tired. This could be a great hotel. The views are fantastic but the decor in the rooms and public areas is tired and the food is mediocre.. The bar area was like a cheap pub from the 1980s. Disappointing and definitely not 5 star as they claim. More like 3 star.

title: Great location for a peaceful break
review: Hotel is understaffed until there is a function on. Gave up on the bar service several times. Also waited 15 mins for someone to serve us in the restaurant one night, but the food was very good and plenty of it. We stayed for 10 days so the menu got a bit repetitive. The restaurant floor was braking up in places and needed replacing. Room was very good with a great terrace outside. Unfortunately the chairs and recliners needed cleaning before being used due to the large number of birds around.  Enjoyed the spa but no staff on duty so we were not able to have a drink as there was no milk or hot water. The spa area needed repainting also the windows needed cleaning.. The front desk and restaurant staff were very good,although at times they seemed to be doing at least two jobs.…

title: Beautiful old convent
review: Dear 97abl,  The team of the Hotel Convento La Magdalena, appreciates the confidence shown. Our goal is to offer all customers a pleasant stay and their comments, we are very useful to improve our day to day.   We will continue working to guarantee the best quality of our services.  We want to see you again.  Receive a cordial greeting,  Customer Support

title: Beautiful but not quite 5 stars
review: This hotel is a fomer convent and whilst conversion  has been done  very well, there remains an Ecclesiastical  feel to place ! Great tranquil location- tho not far from Antequerra town. Stunning architecture. Period furniture- traditional Spanish dark woods. It looks and feels like a Parador except the food doesnt quite match Parador standard. Lovely indoor pool. Effcient staff. But this is not a 5 star hotel experience-  then again pricing isnt 5 star rates either  and hotel offers great value.

title: Great emplacement
review: Dear Kingpaul100,  Thank you very much for taking the time to provide feedback concerning your recent visit at Hotel Convento La Magdalena. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we are determined to ensure that all of our guests have a rewarding stay.  Once again, thank you for your kind comments, and we hope to have soon the opportunity to welcome you back in our hotel.  Warm Regards , Customer support

title: Stunning place for a romantic break
review: A lovely location and building, staff were very nice and helpful, but more care on details needed for it to be truly a five star hotel. A few bits in the room, building and spa were simply not top notch: repairs to walls/ceilings/windows/tiles needed. Great views of El Torcal and lots of birds around.

title: Visit
review: We stayed here 2 nights only rooms available were 100 and junior suite 150 .certainly not 5 srtar food poor in restaurant no hot water in room first morning .staff helpful but not enough of them to cope .services provided re massage etc had to wait 24 hours to confirm as no readily available at hotel .she was very good when she did come ..

title: Great views, food, comfort and peace
review: Located 10 minutes outskirts of Antequera and part of a golfing complex. The views are stunning with El Torcal close by and surrounded by olive groves. The hotel has been converted from a convent and retained much of its peaceful ambience. The  bedrooms are very comfortable, a good size with lovely large bathrooms. Facilities are good and include a spa, nice indoor swimming pool, sauna and Turkish Bath. The restaurant serves excellent breakfast and the dinner ( we chose the €42 taster menu). This might sound a lot but include 3 glasses of good wine and 5 courses that are as good as Michelin star restaurants we’ve been to. You can also eat in the bar area. Parking is onsite and free. Wi-fi is also free and good speed.   The hotel has a large feel to it but only contains about 18…

title: Excelente ubicación, gran servicio - Great location, great service
review: Excelente ubicación, gran servicio. El personal y muy acogedor y amanble. Viajamos allí cada Navidad y nos sentimos como en casa. Muy buen restaurante y volveremos.  Great location, great service. The staff and very welcoming and approachable. We travel there every Christmas and feel like being at home. Very good restaurant and we will comeback.

title: Not a  5* hotel
review: Arrived at 5pm and told no food available in any area of the hotel until 8pm. No internet for 3 hours and after numerous call men came to try to connect us amidst shrugs of "but it is working in the corridor" ...actually I didn't want to stand in the corridor to use the internet!! Went down to eat at 8pm, staff very good meal ok but certainly not 5 * . Back to the room for a bath to find no hot water...reception informed me that perhaps lots of guests used the water ...REALLY!!!  I have had better accommdation in a hostel on the coast. Also I expect the receptionists in a 5* hotel to speak numerous languages , not to say I will try...when I ask a question...thankfully  I speak some Spanish but not good for people who don't. Antequera Hotel was much better organised.....Magdalena…

title: Lovely hotel
review: If you are looking for a refined relaxing classy hotel away from it all then this is for you.   Beautiful building friendly staff. Room was lovely, clean, quiet witj comfortable beds.  Shower massive spa bath and double sinks.   As you walk into the hotel through the front courtyard classical music is playing.   We didnt use the spa but the pool was warm and clean.   Only thing I can complain about was breakfast was offered to us at check in €12 euros. We accepted however after only able to eat a round of toast and fruit juice. No fresh milk for coffee or tea, only long life oat or soya milk and no staff around to ask. We cancelled the next days breakfast.   We loved sitting around the lovely warm fire having evening drinks.

title: Superb food and nice building
review: I was searching for the hotel we stayed at in Antequera when I spotted the Magdalena which was a sister hotel to the one I stayed at. We ate at Convento de la Magdalena one night. The food was great and the building very interesting. Would have loved to stay here and may well return some day. I'm sure it is every bit as good as if not better than the one in town.

title: What a shame- should have been a perfect stay
review: Location stunning. Convent amazing. Beds comfortable. Huge bedrooms.Lovely open fireplace in bar.Great for travelling with dogs. A few minor points like dust in bedroom and unemptied bins from previous.Also we were told spa was cold due to maintenance. But main problem was DINNER! Food cold. Bad service. No one seemed to really care or seem surprised when we left resturant and refused to pay. Then we cancelled breakfast and had a great one at a local bar for 1/8 of price! So really disapointing and feel really let down

title: Hotel with potential but ...
review: We stayed one night in this hotel. The 5 « stars » symbols under the name of the hotel is misleading. It is off course no 5-star hotel. Staff with good intentions but understaffed. A bit old fashion kitchen. Infrastructure with lots of small problems : water came in our room during rain as well as through the safety door of the indoor swimming pool, showers not functioning properly, a cockroach in our room, restaurant at breakfast far too much heated, short of milk (we ordered at the buffet but without result), short of juice, ... To conclude: hotel at great location with great potential but too much shortfalls... especially when you create expectations with 5 stars under your name.

title: Wonderful secluded property
review: This former convent has been wonderfully repurposed into a very luxurious, secluded hotel.  Our room was expansive, one space for a beautiful sitting area with a fireplace, and another area for the bedroom.  The bathroom was larger than most European hotels.  The common areas including the lobby, bar and restaurant, and indoor pool and spa were clean, fresh, and charming.  The grounds were beautiful making for pleasant walks, or just relaxing on one of the patios.  We thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay.

title: Fabulous Tranquil 5 Star Boutique Hotel
review: On the outskirts of Antequera on a hill side is this beautifully restored Convent. It is now one of the best Boutique Hotels that we have stayed in. Although we didn't get the chance to use it it has a really nice Spa.There is also a golf course to enjoy. But the things that impressed us most of all, are all that you want in a quality Hotel. A welcoming reception, great rooms with comfortable beds and good food. The breakfast choice is just sensational and if you are a bit of a foodie there is/was a set 5 course gastronomic evening meal including wine for only 42 Euros. WOW. This is a tastefully decorated hotel in good condition that is well located for touring the area.

title: Wow
review: We stayed at the Convento for 2 nights. We were treated with utmost courtesy and respect by all the attentive staff. The setting is stunning the rooms are well furnished and clean. The facilities are great and the restaurant serves the best food that I have eaten in Spain.

title: Special place
review: My husband and I chose this hotel because of it’s great location and beautiful surroundings. As you drive up to the hotel you can see by the beautiful scenery that you are in a special place. The building itself, with it’s massive doors and 15 th century architecture brings you back in time. The view from your room is of distant mountains and miles of olive tree groves. Truly a peaceful place. When we arrived there was a wedding taking place, but in no way did it change the enjoyment of our stay. The staff here is always super helpful and friendly. We booked a standard room and it was very large by most hotel standards. The bathroom was roomy as well, with double sinks, a shower, and a separate jetted bathtub. We took advantage of the spa area. This area could use a little…

title: Hermoso lugar! Beautiful!
review: The convento offers wonderful views on the surrounding nature. Room was very spacious. Price/quality ratio was very good.  I recommend visiting Antequera and the natural reserve of the Torcal (wonderful), if you like natural landscapes. We had a pleasant, relaxing stay.

title: Two rooms with a suite
review: Estimada Elena,  Gracias por compartir su excelente comentario con el resto de usuarios de Tripadvisor.  Nos alegra que haya disfrutado tanto de nuestro hotel como de la bella ciudad de Antequera.  Esperamos volver a verla muy muy pronto.  Atentamente,  Hotel Convento La Magdalena

title: Anti Climax
review: Traveling with another couple, we were pleased to be booked in a large suite with adjoining bedrooms.  The suite was so large that it included a dinning room with a table for 8.  There is an attached banquet facility that used to be a church which could accommodate large groups.

title: Group of 25 golfers and partners
review: Simply fantastic despite the worst weather in the area for years..... breakfast a royal TREAT..... food tasty and plenty of options... beer prices reasonable....  staff outstanding.... room problems including flooding sorted with a smile and promptly. Second visit will be back.

title: Nice setting and good food
review: Estimado William,  Muchas gracias por compartir su excelente opinión con el resto de usuarios de Tripadvisor. Nos alegra muchísimo haber cumplido con sus expectativas.  Nos vemos muy pronto  ¡Hasta la próxima!  Atentamente  Equipo Hotel Antequera

title: Romantic night for 2 - Ruined!!
review: We had a nice meal here on Sunday evening. The Convento de la Magdalena is in a lovely setting about 5km from Antequera but well worth travelling the distance. The food and wine were great and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Prices are reasonable for a 5 star hotel.

title: Holiday
review: The hotel looked stunning on paper and I thought it would make for a lovely romantic Valentine's treat for my wife and I. Indeed when we arrived after dark it looked beautiful even mythical standing out against the surrounding valleys and hills! The romance stopped there! We booked through booking.com and requsted a double bed (obviously!) and much to my dismay we were presented with 2 single beds in a freezing cold and somewhat dated room! No others were available we were told, "excellant start" I retorted! Never mind, being the fun and positive people that we are, we were going to make the most of it! Dinner beckoned, so we headed to the dining room, it is in the Michellin guide after all! Negatives first; poor lightning, far to hot (actually we needed to warm up from our…

title: Fabulous!!
review: Estimado Jon,   Sentimos mucho que nuestro establecimiento no haya cumplido con sus expectativas.  Hemos tomado nota de  todos sus comentarios para hacerlos extensibles a todos los departamentos implicados. No solemos tener queja alguna de nuestro servicio de restauración, pues siempre son buenas críticas. Intentamos ofrecer lo mejor de nuestros fogones para que todos los clientes disfruten de nuestro restaurante.  Sentimos mucho lo sucedido.   Gracias una vez más por sus comentarios. Nos ayudan a mejorar.   Nos encantaría que volviera, así poder demostrarle que nuestros servicios son excelentes.   Reciba un cordial saludo

title: Lovely setting , wellness area disappoints
review: The setting is amazing. Entrance fantastic. A very tired 5 star establishment, we paid for an upgrade to have access to The wellness area... suite was huge with a nice bathroom but tired. Bed not so comfy and wooden panel rattled. Sauna did not heat up and steam room smelt, not a relaxing wellness area.. just in front of loud pool. Not worth the extra money.  We received misinformation about the tours.. carmina del Rey does not take 30 mins.  Wonderful run from the hotel on side of the hill.   Breakfast more pricey that other places we stayed at but great selection .. annoying being told to book at check in or more expensive if u go down without booking.

title: Great Location
review: Estimado cliente;  Ante todo agradecemos haya compartido su opinión con el resto de usuarios.  Nos alegra que le haya gustado el hotel y tomamos nota sobre sus comentarios de la zona de Spa. El equipo técnico ya lo ha solucionado y todo funciona correctamente.  En cuanto a la información del Caminito del Rey sentimos lo sucedido, pero nos resulta raro que haya sido información de nuestro departamento de reservas, pues todos enviamos los datos correctos, indicando que en coche se tardan 40 minutos aproximadamente.   Una vez más le agradecemos su comentario y esperamos volver a verlos muy pronto.

title: Nice place to spend a night or two
review: The hotel was great  for the location, room very nice, nice jaccuzi, almost with all you need (coffee maker) Breakfast and restaurant very nice, but please its a 5 star hotel , so don't go around with a trolley to clear the tables. No sight. Very good hotel when you have a dog, nice walking.Good restaurant, but at Christmas evening at 22u you had to finish your dinner, because the close that the staff can go home....to celebrate. So in the room at 22u30 nothing else to do. Refreshment of the Spa is needed.

title: Very nice hotel!
review: We spent Christmas Eve here and took their Christmas package which included 1 nights accommodation, dinner and the buffet breakfast.  Both meals were excellent.  The location is beautiful, as is the building.  The spa facilities are great and the staff are helpful and friendly.  The reason why I did not give this place a 5 rating is that our rooms were both very hot and we could not individually control the airconditioning.  We slept poorly as a result.

title: Peaceful Old Converted Convent
review: Estimada LeahSydney;  Muchas gracias por dedicar su tiempo a comentar su experiencia con el resto de usuarios. Tomamos nota de su comentario y lo haremos extensible a todo el equipo.  Esperamos volver por nuestras instalaciones.   Aprovechamos la ocasión para desearle Feliz Año Nuevo.

title: Beautiful old convent
review: This hotel is feels as tho u r in the middle of nowhere but, in reality,  antwquera is not that far away. A former convent , the architecture is old and really impressive. The public areas are well furnished and the bedrooms are comfortable and stylish. Ensuote bathrooms decent size. Swimming pool is a lovely modern addition althougg the spa category/description is a little optimistic for what is actually on offer. Enthusiastic staff. Wonderful food at dinner. Breakfast somewhat disappponting- a little sparse. Great pricing for a unique property.

title: Weekend break
review: Remotely located hotel in the grounds of a golf course in the outskirts of Antequera. Old convent with original features in evidence throughout the building. Basic spa facilities with indoor pool. Excellent restaurant with tasting menu on offer for a reasonable price given the quantity and quality of the food provided.

title: Quiet Gem
review: We stayed here two nights as part of our organized bicycle tour through Andalusia. The room was wonderfully elegant:  quiet, clean, luxurious bathroom, and windows to be thrown open to the mountain views and fresh air.  Breakfast buffet was excellent, as was dinner in the bar one night with our group, where we were served rounds of tapas and Vino Tinto Verano.  Lounging on the lawn, we sampled dates from the palms, and visited the resident donkey and fowl up the hill.  Hiking and mountain biking are available right out the door, with a view of Antequera up the hill.

title: Dissatisfied
review: This is supposed to be a 5* hotel but it lacked many qualities for this. The room was lovely and clean, unfortunately the air- con kept breaking down. When reception were informed he kept saying it had been fixed, it took them until our final afternoon to sort it.  The spa looked lovely until on closer inspection you could see it was very tired, with tiles missing in the pool and hadn't been cleaned for some time. The sun beds were mostly ripped and the jacuzzi was so hot it burnt your legs.  There was a lack of staff so if you wanted a drink there was often a long wait. Food was very hit and miss with most of it being off the menu.  What this hotel needs most is a lot of updating with the necessary attention to detail.  I must congratulate the lady on reception who , I think,…

title: Older rooms but comfortable
review: We stayed at this hotel for one night as part of our cycling holiday. From the outside, it looks quite nice. We were assigned a junior suite, which was quite spacious with a cozy and good sized family room with fireplace. Our room faced the main courtyard. It's not a modern space, but the room was clean, minus some sticky spots by the door. Not a deal breaker as the hotel does provide slippers. The bathroom is spacious; however the shower squeaked when in use, and the soaker tub (which we didn't use) had a slow drip. Breakfast was unimpressive, with very little protein options and not a large spread. In their defense, breakfast was just being setup when our group entered the dining room - we had an early start that day.  We didn't have much time to explore this hotel and its…

title: coffee / lunch
review: Well,  how disappointing were we, after using this hotel for over 4 yrs, we took new friends up for lunch in the bar, we always have a sandwich or salad. But looking on the menu I noticed that the prices had doubled, the drinks cost over 15€ for 4 small lagers and a coffee. So we went down into Antequera to the Italian for lunch, we won't be back and I'm spreading the word.

title: Outstanding!
review: I stayed at this hotel is part of a biking trip in Andalusia.   This was the nicest property we stayed in, beautiful in every way. The building itself is old and interesting, the rooms large and very well appointed. Other facilities include a restaurant, bar and a pool/hot tub/sauna area. Bathrooms amazing!  We had one dinner and breakfast at the restaurant, both excellent.   The hotel is located on a hill with beautiful views of the surrounding countryside. One can sit out on the lawn overlooking the olive groves and city below.   While we were there, they were setting up for a wedding. This would be an incredible spot for such an event.    Very lovely, relaxing spot!

title: We were only there for the restaurant. Busy but we were still well looked after
review: We were a group of about 30, we were well looked after, the service was friendly and the room we were in was very nice. The food was good but not as good as the reputation lead me to expect, nice but not special. Lovely place but the food needs to up its level in order to match the surroundings and reputation

title: Great place to stay
review: We spent one night here but could have stayed another. The property is well located close to Antequera and comes with great views. The swimming pool and spa facilities were well maintained and much appreciated after a day's sightseeing. The restaurant produced some really good food and the wine selection was broad and well priced

title: Visited for lunch only
review: We called in to the Convento de la Magdalena for lunch after our golf had been rained off, yes, rained off in August! There’s no doubt this place is beautiful but I certainly think it’s let down by the quality of it’s lunch offering. We ordered ciabatta sandwiches accompanied by a glass of red wine. The sandwiches were ok though the bread was obviously frozen as served rock hard, most disappointing was the wine. You’d expect an establishment of this quality to serve only the best but it was very poor and most definitely the worst glass I’d had anywhere during my visit. When we pointed this out to the waitress she said they’d had complaints before, well why still serve it? The Convento de la Magdalena just oozes class, beauty and charm but is let down by the detail, shame as it…

title: Off the beaten track
review: After a short drive through an increasingly beautiful landscape we arrived at the monastery. Seeing this marvellous facade, entering the splendidly decorated cloister already made us feel good about having chosen this hotel. Reception was pleasant and the room we were given adequate and spacious. Maybe the decoration not quite on the level of the antique part but not ugly. Our room had double doors opening towards a lovely vegetable garden and a splendid view.  We had an excellent dinner, served by a most friendly waiter and the next morning a lavish breakfast including all imaginable Spanish delicacies of superb quality.  After some relaxing time in the pool and steam bath we continued our voyage, feeling extremely satisfied with our stay.  Fantastic value. Highly recommend.

title: SO ROMANTIC AND SPECIAL! UNFORGETABLE. ETERNAL CHARM
review: Just came back from the most romantic week-end ever at this stylish hotel. My cousin celebrated his wedding there and we had the greatest time. The staff amazing, how they handled all our needs and made our stay really special.   Always with a smile and all kindness. The room was beautiful, comfortable and a big bathroom. Amazing views to "La Sierra". Peaceful place. Lady at the Spa was very sweet. At breakfast the waitress was very caring with us and the children. At the front desk the man that did our check- out Sunday at 4pm was very patient!!! He had to bare with a smile my rushing to get to the Ave on time. He did it with a big smile. Thanks!!  And a very special thank you to the best waitress. Georgina (Josefina) A truly proffessional lady!!!!  She help us with everything.…

title: A chance to stay in a convent
review: The hotel is in an attractive setting near Antequera. The walk into town would take an hour, along a beautiful country path. The hotel restoration is quite good and the spa functions well. The rooms were good. I didn't think the food was consistently  good. We had one good evening meal and one very so-so meal. There was a wedding until past 3am the second night we were there, but in fact it wasn't too noisy. Staff were friendly. All in all, a bit of a surprise the hotel has five stars.  Finally, there is really no need for piped music, in and out of doors, in a hotel attempting to create a tranquil atmosphere!

title: Spanish hidden gem
review: This is a lovely hotel in spectacular scenery on the outskirts of Antequera. It is a converted convent which retains some of its original features and is a pleasure to stay in. The bedrooms are comfortable and quiet and some have their own gardens! The restaurant is lovely and the food excellent. Breakfast was very good and the staff very pleasant and helpful.

title: Not 5 star
review: Very nice location . Big clean rooms with large bathroom . Super good restaurant Only staff at reception speaks English  Treatments in Spa are not at all professional . Spa is not to recommend  All day long the guest have to listen to the same sad funeral music , as well in the bar , restaurant , corridors .... We did not understand why they want to make the guest feel sad in such a nice place They should stop playing the same sad cd all day long . No luggage service , no drinking water in rooms . No water boiler for tea or coffee

title: Fab hotel and surrounding,staff and restaurant let in down
review: We visited this hotel for a special occasion.The Convecto is in a beautiful setting and an excellent building.Check in was very efficient.Room was lovely spotless clean.Air con was poor.Bar was understaffed,and when restaurant opened,they used staff from bar.Good menu but my potatoes were raw!!!When we explained to staff,she shrugged her shoulders and said "sorry" it was never mentioned again!! No compensation,or explanation from restaurant manager???If you do eat here,order your drinks in restaurant and take them through into bar,once you have finished your meal.Poor really for a hotel that claims to be 5*!!!We won't be back!!!

title: A magical place in Antequera
review: This hotel is nested on the hills just above the city of Antequera, in between el Torcal and the city itself. Its location allows a breath-taking view of the surrounding  landscape in a quiet and isolated spot, almost magical al night. The hotel service was very efficient and its catering service was very good. We had booked a regular room, but when we arrived we were offered a suite for only 20€ more. The cost of the room included spa and breakfast. The suite was really nice, with a classical touch, coherent with the overall structure, that is an old convent. I enjoyed the stay very much, except for the spa. This clearly necessitated some maintenance work.

title: Relaxing visit with Dog
review: Set in some stunning countryside, with great walks and absolute quiet except for birds and insects. Staff were courteous and professional, all spoke fabulous English. We had a garden room which was well appointed with lovely bathroom, separate shower, all very clean. Perfect if you are travelling with a dog. We walked into Antequera which took just over an hour. Had dinner in the restaurant which was delicious , definitely recommend and go back for the value for money it proved to be

title: A relaxing place
review: Staff was very helpful and nice, particularly at the reception. They arranged tickets for El Caminito del Rey, gave us directions to help us move around, arranged a snack when we couldn't take breakfast. Breakfast was excellent and dinner, although with only four options, was adequate and provided a balanced Mediterranean diet. The service could be extremely slow when they had more clients, though. Antequera is a lovely city, worth visiting.

title: Special place worth the stop
review: We were on a cycling trip with Trek travel and spent two nights here. Employees were especially courteous. Beautiful public rooms since a renovated convent with great views. Golf is close if you like that but also a very nice natural walking/running trail overlooking Antequerra. Great breakfast buffet but no dinner. Rooms very large bathroom with working jacuzzi tubs.

title: Location and food are remarkable
review: La Magdalena is located in a breathtaking mountain area. It claims  to have 5 stars and the location is indeed 5 stars. We will certainly come here again but there are a few things during our saturday to monday visit the last weekend in april that not really match the 5 stars: The room we were asigned was room 101 - first floor.  There is no view as the only window (40x40cm) is under the ceiling. We directly refused this room and had instead room 0002. The 0001 to 0009 is a part of an extension to the original Convento. Charming room, doors to a small kitchen garden perfect views (to the south), bathroom with whirlpool. It is a little remote to the mainbuilding but we accepted it- and enjoyed it. Soundproofing was however not included in the construction. We could hear room 0001…

title: Terrible experience
review: We booked a 2 day stay in this place in February via booking.com to 4-6 May. One day before the stay the hotel sent us a message cancelling the stay due to overbooking. They tried to put us in other hotel (with less quality, but from the same company) for the same price we paid to Convento de la Magdalena.  We called the costumer support of booking that told us that they never should contact us directly, without contact booking.com first. The booking.com costumer service was amazing and gave us other options with similar quality and payed the difference from what we paid to stay in convento de la Magdalena to the stay in the new hotel. This is not how we expect to be treated by a 5-star hotel. We do not recomend at all.

title: A sense of peace and tranquility
review: My husband and I stayed initially for one night in April then was due to move on to stay at a different hotel for the rest of our break. However, after arriving at the 2nd hotel there was no comparison to this one and ended up returning for a further 3 days as we enjoyed it here so much. On the 1st night we had a mini suite with two double beds, very comfortable, good quality bed linen and pillows. Beautiful bathroom with wonderful toiletries and a jacuzzi bath. The following nights we were in room 101 as they were fully booked but they did inform us that this room had no windows but it was still a beautiful room on split levels. The spa area is beautiful - pool very warm. The steam and sauna is on a timer which didn't seem to get hot enough quick enough. The surrounding area of…

title: An interesting experience
review: A unique experience staying in a former convent.  I kept imaging what it would have been like to be a resident in this place when it was a convent.  I found it a little creepy, but interesting.  The bedroom was a little small, but then there was a separate sitting room (this was a nun's apartment, but was it for 1 or 2?) where it was easy to stage our bags.  The bathroom shower was a little small, but definitely was adequate and functional.   Roosters in the morning started at 4:30am (we had a room facing the entrance) and someone kept hitting their snooze alarm--they were relentless!  Overall, I'd say I was satisfied with our 1 night stay, but probably wouldn't have wanted an extended stay.

title: Great location, relaxing, value for money, friendly service
review: Stayed 4 nights with a family in two connected double rooms. Located few kilometers from the attractive town of Antequera in a relaxing natural surrounding. Interesting building, a former monastery. Room was fine, with direct access to a nice garden. Very good breakfast, excellent choice. Dinner was also good, choice for vegetarians is somewhat limited,  service is a bit slow, but very friendly. Pool area is well maintained, it is not very big, but for some reason was not actively used and we had it for ourselves. Overall, much recommended.

title: Great away from it location, peaceful and great value
review: We stayed with our adult daughter for 3 nights in March, weather was OK, so didn't need air con or heating.  We were given 2 bedrooms with a shared lounge area which was really nice. Breakfast was excellent, mainly continental with wide selection, but will cook to order. We ate there one night at the bar and had drinks, pricing was very good. The hotel is remote and peaceful with good facilities, if you want to travel the region it is a reasonable base but be mindful that some roads can be a bit rough.   Only complaint was the music that kicked in at 9am and ran to the late evening, it isn't needed and adds nothing.  Scenery is stunning

title: Not a 5star hotel
review: What a disappointment this hotel was. It is listed as a 5 star hotel and it is most definitely not. The room we were given was ok. The shower had seen better days and was difficult to operate. The decor was tired looking and it seems that some investment is needed. The duvet on the bed did not have a cover on it. It was between two sheets.   We were booked in for half board and there were no clear suggestions of what we were able to eat for our evening meal or what we could order off the menu. The food we chose and served was disgusting. We never got our desserts as they were too busy serving 3 large tables who arrived. The dining area was cold and draughty and this was made worse by a diner opening  an outside door we presume so that they could smoke indoors. Breakfast was not…

title: Want to experience a night in a five star coffin?
review: Booked with British Airways to stay in a standard double at this establishment for the two nights of the 12th and 13th of March 2017. Upon arrival we were given the keys to room 101.When opening the door and finding a light switch, a must given this room has no windows, we climbed two flights of stairs to the creepiest bedroom we have ever experienced in over 55 years of travelling the globe. 'The hotel is full' we were informed and as we had already pre-paid were transferred to their sister four star hotel down in the town which is a very basic coaching stop over. Unless you want to experience what life in an air less coffin must be like DO NOT even enter room 101. How we would have got our heavy suitcases up into this strange medieval loft will always allude us, and my wife is…

title: Reservation was not honored
review: My husband and I had reserved a room for a 3 night stay, together with our dog who had been approved by telephone.  To our astonishment, upon arrival we were informed that the hotel was fully booked and that we had been re-booked in Hotel Antequera in the town.  For obvious reasons we found this totally unacceptable.  Obviously I cannot grade the Hotel Style and Amenities etc. as we were turned away.

title: Dreadful lunch
review: This review is for the restaurant.....it doesn´t appear to be listed separately on Trip Advisor. We went for lunch on Sunday with friends. It began with a badly chipped wine glass. Our starters were mediocre at best. Mains were dreadful. Thin & cheap cuts of ´steak´delivered to us on cold plates.   The plates were wheeled into the restaurant on a trolley which was ignored for 5 minutes or so by the serving staff. When delivered to us the food was cold. We complained & received a nod from our server.I complained a second time and our food was removed with apologies. New dishes were brought. The best part of the meal was the desserts. This place is supposed to be 5 star. It isn´t. The main dishes cost €20 + and are no better than an average menu del dia at €8-10. Bread sticks…

title: Ian Banks
review: We did visit with friends from Malaga who have stayed previously. I have some very positive and negative things to say. Firstly the setting is magnificent and the old convent very impressive. The hotel restoration is classic thoughtful and well done. We enjoyed both breakfast and dinner in an elevated position over the valley and olive groves. This is a worth the stay for this alone. Also staff friendly and obliging. It is not 5 star though. In fact they do not charge 5 star. The rooms are unevenly heated  our kids room was only just warm enough. The key cards kept deactivating and ment frequent trips to reception. Worst of all the rooms on the lower level are connected by a hall that is below freezing in winter. The sauna is in disrepair and one room we saw stunk of mold. These…

title: December Visit
review: Stayed here for the weekend for a wedding ,this was a gorgeous hotel set in a lovely location with some amazing views but a couple of small details let it down a little, the hotel itself is beautiful with some stunning features,the rooms were nice enough and spacious but don't have any Tea/coffee making facilities and the lighting wasn't the best it was very dimly lit ,also the robes they have available were very badly kept and the ties were cut on the ones we had so you couldn't tie them up if you wanted to go down to the pool area/ spa in your bathing suit, also the staff were lovely and attentive but at times there didn't seem to be enough of them like at check in there was only one person handling around 20 people checking in at once so there was a long wait and at the bar I…

title: Peace and Tranquility
review: Beautiful, peaceful location, very friendly and helpful staff. We had a junior suite with a comfortable bed, sofa, mini fridge and TV. The restaurant offered a good choice of food that was of a high quality and reasonably priced. There was a lovely log fire, perfect on a cold, wet November night. Excellent breakfast.

title: LOVELY STAY
review: We stayed for a weekend with friends! Do choose if you are 4 the rooms 203-204 that come with a lovely salon to share. The staff is friendly and eager to help, breakfast is very good and parking very convenient. Do not miss the SPA, remember to book at front desk in advance.

title: Loved it!!
review: The hotel is absolutely beautiful! It is located approximately 10 minutes from town, in a very quiet and serene setting. The service is top-notch, and the breakfast offered was simply fantastic. The rooms are very comfortable, and the bathrooms are large and very clean. I highly recommend this hotel.  The spa does not quite live up to the hype. I would not call it a spa, but rather an area with a pool and they call in a masseuse when a massage is scheduled. The sauna and Turkish bath were both not functioning.

title: Not a five star hotel
review: Went with friends to celebrate a 70th birthday. From arriving we all thought wow what a superb peaceful and stunning looking place. We checked with reception that our table for 5 people at 8.30 was booked and was told yes. We all decided to have lunch in bar area which was superb. After lunch we all went down to the spa. And had to ring reception to have all facilities switched on. The sauna didn't work and the steam room was cold.   The bed rooms where clean and comfortable. But in our bathroom the walk in shower had no shower head holder. The plugs in both sinks and bath did not work.  Arrived at the restaurant for our 8.30pm booking to be told we didn't have a booking but was seated and ordered food and bottles of wine our rose wine we kept on asking for as was in a cooler at…

title: Excellent
review: Superb location, outstanding food, reasonable prices and fantastic service. Have not stayed there yet, this was a lunch with friends, but planning to stay next year and take advantage of the many facilities available.

title: We only went there to look at the hotel, but Wow!
review: We were staying locally at Casa Magel in Valle de Abdalajis (near Antequerra) and had heard about this former convent which has been converted into a 5-star hotel. Well, wow, what a sight it was, an amazing building with the skeleton of a 16th century convent now turned into a beautiful hotel.  We wandered around the building and eventually decided to stay for  coffee and dessert. We were not disappointed as the coffee was lovely and the desserts fantastic. Although you would expect the price to be a little on the high side, as the saying goes - you get what you pay for - and the quality was first class.  We will consider this as an option for staying in the area in future as the prices don't look too bad for such a quality hotel. Well worth a look if nothing more.

title: Interesting historical hotel in a pleasant setting
review: This hotel is located in the highest part of Antequera, beyond the golf course. It's hard to reach if you don't have a car, but the atmosphere is idyllic as the hotel is surrounded by hills, valleys and olive plantations. The hotel was an ancient cloister and it has still its fascinating frescoes and structures, such as the original chapel. The entrance is grand and well cared, the hall is a bit vapid, but the room is very big and charming, with original colors and pieces. In the hotel you can find a beautiful spa, with sauna, turkish bath, Jacuzzi, herbal, tea and coffee room, and a nice outdoor garden with views of the valleys. The breakfast is nice but cannot be compared to the whole rest of the experience. The price is also reasonable for the beauty of the place.

title: The most beautiful, stunning and amazing place can't wait to go back :-)
review: We got married in Antequera and had our afters in La Magdalena we stayed there for 3 nights and it was beyond amazing!  It is steeped in history and located in the most beautiful setting in the mountains.  The staff are so nice, the food is awesome and the rooms are absolutely gorgeous.  All our Wedding party commented on what an amazing place it is and said they will never forget it and a lot of them want to go back.  When you see it yourself you will know what I am talking about go and enjoy it :-)

title: Great place to stay.
review: Superb venue. Views were incredible. Pool with outdoor area was lovely  Very clean accommodation, great breakfast and evening meal in restaurant.   Would highly recommend and if in area again would definitely stay here.   Antiqurra interesting place to visit too we found the underground car park, just as you come into Aniquerra was very handy and not expensive. Dinner in the bull ring interesting too

title: Excellent Hotel
review: A really enjoyable stay in a quiet and friendly hotel,  the room was comfortable, the staff were friendly, the meals in the restaurant were really good.  All in all an excellent hotel and great value for money.  I will be back ...

title: Outstanding and Unique
review: This Hotel is set in a wonderful peaceful location.it has a wonderfully appointed Spa with pool. The rooms are beautiful and many have an outdoor private garden, which grows organic tomatoes, herbs and vegetables. Patio doors lead you from your bedroom to these private gardens. However the highlight for us was the Restaurant ....the food is incredible...try the duck or steak....yum !!! Overall the value for money is super and they do nice deals with Antequero Golf Club, which is a challenging course. The staff are lovely and Antonio is an understanding Professional to his fingertips.  This is a unique gem.......just go and book it!!

title: A Jewel In the Mountains.
review: We stayed with friends at La Magdalena on a two night, two games of golf break. The hotel staff are amazing, very welcoming and helpful. We initially called in for lunch one day and decided to stay for two nights! The lunch was delightful and convinced us that dinner would be an even better experience. The breakfast , buffet was excellent and the chef was fast and very good . We came back after a hard days golf to enjoy the pool, sauna and steam room all of which were good. Then we had a gastronomic experience which to be truly honest was the best food we have eaten in Spain to date. The tapas were delightful. The entrees were varied and interesting and the mains were delicious. Ample portions and beautifully presented. There is a very good wine list to appeal to every palate…

title: Magnificent location & product
review: Beautiful location, magnificent food, friendly staff. We booked for the golf at nearby Antequera but we would return for the quality & beauty of the hotel. RThe food was superb & truly 5 star quality at affordable prices

title: About to return for the third time
review: We cannot visit southern Spain without staying at  the Convento, always spot on. Majestic surroundings with food to match, Antequera is full of history, try to visit Lobo park if you get the chance and learn things you never knew about wolves.

title: Staff need management support
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our two weeks at the Hotel Convento de la Magdalena.  Our Junior Suite was spacious clean and well serviced. The breakfasts were excellent with a wide choice of local produce and we had dinner there three times which was enjoyable.  The town of Antequera is a 10 minute drive away and worth visiting. We spent many evenings there enjoying tapas.  Our greatest disappointment was the golf course as it was in disgraceful condition. Only the greens had been watered and the rest of course was a dust bowl which made it virtually unplayable.   During our time at the hotel we never saw a manager. The staff are left unsupervised and unsupported. They did their best and on the whole did well but there were a number of times they would have benefited by having somebody…

title: Disappointed!
review: Spent 2 nights with a group of golfers. It was organized for us. Hotel is in a beautiful location set amongst mountains and olive groves. Very peaceful, but in need of renovation!  Our room had a separate small sitting room, bedroom was dark, very small windows. Bathroom was nice with a jacuzzi bathtub. Shower didn't work as the faucet to turn the water on was broken and missing! When I complained- couldn't change room as hotel was full. Reception promised to fix it for the next day. It didn't happen as they didn't have the part! At least the jacuzzi bathtub worked.  Spa was not great! It needs TLC. I almost burnt myself in the shower before using the pool. The cold water button didn't work. The other shower didn't work either. The water in the jacuzzi didn't look clean!  Inside…

title: Let down by beds
review: Lovely hotel. Great setting and a gorgeous building. The bathroom was great and room nice. However the beds were dreadfully uncomfortable so we didn't have a good night sleep. Also it desperately needs an outdoor pool. The restaurant was lovely and breakfast great

title: Total peace and relaxation
review: If total peace and relaxation is what your after then this is the place for you.  Off the beaten track, but only 10 mins to beautiful Antequera.  Lovely room and hot and cold buffet breakfast was amazing.  Spa with treatments available on Saturdays at a reasonable price.  You must explore Antequera, it's 30+ churches and the Moorish castle and Dolmens.  Plenty to keep you busy.  Book the Caminito Del Rey through the hotel, or you won't get a ticket, it is truly breathtaking!  El Torcal is another must for a morning out, plus a day sunbathing and swimming in one of the lakes around Ardales.  Stayed for 7 nights and would recommend wholeheartedly to other couples.

title: Very rural,stunning landscape,would make an excellent wedding venue
review: Three night stay,lovely breakfast,excellent restaurant ,beef tataki superb.not expensive. They opened up the catacombs for me,very interesting history. The walks are amazing as is the wildlife particular the birds. Lovely old town of Antequera 15 minute drive. Car is a must. An excellent venue for a wedding

title: Undoubtedly, one of the best  in Spain!
review: Difficult to know where to begin this review, so let us begin with..... magnificent,    then move on to exceptional and finish with stunning! Magnificent building which as the name indicates was a former convent and which incorporates the original church and cloisters into this modern operation. We chose this, to us, fairly local hotel as it features on our "bucket list" of hotels to visit and a special birthday made it an appropriate choice. Exceptional accommodation. We chose to splash out on a suite for our stay,  which proved to be enormous but modestly priced for what was offered! Furnished in traditional Spanish style it was beautifully appointed with a sitting room, huge bed and large sized bathroom fitted with a jacuzzi and double shower cabinet, Terry bathrobes,…

title: Brace yourself Rodney - men at work
review: This old, well very old building has been converted into a hotel/ spa with a restaurant. It is on the outskirts of Antequera. Little hint. If you are travelling from Valle de Abdalajis/ El Chorro on the A343 and you are using your Sat  Nav then it may send you into Antequera and then do a recip on yourself. I should of had courage in my conviction. Just a few clicks after Lobo Park on the A343 there is a small sign(Hotel Convento la Magdalena) that indicates a small road off to the left that appears to go nowhere. Well this is a new road that has been built and sat nav (mine didnt) doesn't know it. It saves about ten mins off your journey.  The building is beautiful and take some time to wander around the outside and also the inside. The owners are still in the  process of…

title: Beautiful location
review: This hotel is located at a magnificent location. The rooms are beautiful with good facilities. Not sure this is a real 5-star hotel, however, the prices aren't 5-star as well. So the price-quality is in a very good balance. The food was delicious. The employees are very friendly. This hotel is perfect for a one night stay and I can truly recommend it.

title: Unexpectedly wonderful
review: Stayed here for one night on the way from Malaga to Córdoba. We arrived late to see the most stunning of buildings lit up. It was magical.   Having arrived at 11 and the restaurant was closed but the staff quickly rustled up some sandwiches and gave us some lovely cold beer- which cost almost nothing.   The whole place was full of history and character. Our room was really large and spacious and simply appointed walking out onto a terrace. Once we could see the view in the daylight it did not disappoint.   There is a charming restaurant and a love indoor pool and jacuzzi. The su loungers outside were really nice-shame we did not have time to relax.   I wish we had had the chance to stay longer. I'd recommend for couples, golfers, cyclists or those on a spa weekend.   The staff…

title: Unbelievable
review: When we came for a romantic week,  we didn't expect that the room would fall apart?  The shower was broken, the music didn't work, the bathtub didn't have hot water, and then it broke so you couldn't get the water out.  There should had been a spa and massage. The pool had dirt all over, the tyrki bath was not on, the only thing that worked was the jazussi.   We were so disappointed!  But then we went to the hotels restaurant, and WOOW THAT WAS 1st class!! really good, amazing food.

title: Amazing!
review: Hello Mrs Stephanie,   I appologize for all the incidence that you had with us, i'll personally invistigate your case so as to let all in order.   Would you like please let me know your full name and surname, arrival date and room number.   Best regards   Adel  Front desk manager

title: Excellent Historic hotel outside town
review: Stayed 2 nights here with my wife. Very nice staff, good breakfast and dinner. Location is about a 12 euro taxi into Antequera. Beautiful hotel. Really first class all the way. Interesting building with old chapel, courtyard, and crypt. Comfortable beds, rain fall shower head, jacuzzi tub with view of orchards. Sad to leave such a magical place.

title: Surreal
review: Located in the country side just outside Antequera this former convent has large rooms, many with their own separate living area. Traditionally furnished the rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms spacious. There is an indoor swimming pool and spa on site. A golf course next door. You will no doubt have a car if you choose to stay here. Service and food was extremely good.

title: Not 5*
review: Great location in mountains. Large lovely rooms (104 room was really nice). But it is a strange experience! It is really good value as it includes steam sauna and pool in room price, and has an excellent breakfast (fresh omelettes made to order and really large variety of food). Great views across the valley from the dining rooms. Fantastic for walkers and cyclists. But it is old and desperately needs updating. It has these massive rooms for weddings that when not in use look peculiar and haunting. Tip- speak to reception before heading to sauna/steam as they need to be switched and need 45min to be set up. Basically it all needs a revamp and all public spaces need a desperate re think.

title: Looking for somewhere special?
review: What a wonderful two days we had here. The hotel was wonderful and quite unique. It was previously a convent. Lots of character  The setting in a valley of olive trees with the mountaIns was stunning and so serene. The staff were friendly and helpful.  Dinner was excellent as was the breakfast. If you want to get away "from it all"  then I would highly recommend it.

title: Fantastic base for exploring Granada, Cordoba, and Antequera
review: If you want to stay in one place and explore the delights of Granada, Cordoba, Ronda, and Antequera (Alcazar, El Torcal, Dolmens) and want to be out in the typical rolling countryside of olive groves, then you can't do much better than this comfortable hotel. We spent 5 nights there and dined there one evening, which was very good. The view from the dining room is magnificent, overlooking the olive groves and mountain range. Breakfast was great with meats, cheeses, omelettes, cereals, fruit, bread, croissants, and other pastries. The receptionists and bar staff were very friendly and attentive. There is a lovely easy 9km walk from the hotel into Antequera along the south side of the valley, which has a very gradual descent. Note: Google maps thinks this is a wiggly road that you…

title: One night stay
review: A lovely tranquil hotel a few km from anteqeura .beaufiful room, bedding , towels . breakfast excellent. Will stay again .we used the spa we were the only people in it that day.not all of the equipment was functioning so that's a downside if that was your main reason for visiting. The hotel is in a fantastic ,atmospheric location but our sat Nat sent us to a dirt track and then a path which was confusing . Take the A 343 to get there

title: Grand but needs some TLC
review: We enjoyed a one night stay here in August for me, my husband and teenage son. Firstly, the good points; the building is magnificent, truly breathtaking and in beautiful surroundings. It is handy for the golf course where the two men went off for the morning to enjoy a round. The nature is stunning with plenty of wildlife including mountain goats who were climbing the rocky terrain, truly a sight to behold. The staff were extremely pleasant. The beds were large and comfortable and the bedroom and bathroom were absolutely enormous and spotless. If I wasn't being picky, it should really end there but there were a few minus points which is why I can't give it five stars. Firstly, we arrived after our check in time to discover that our room wasn't ready and after being told it would…

title: Beautiful Property
review: Beautiful secluded property with great views and amazing architecture. Large rooms but could use a little more light. Fantastic bike riding in the area and a short trip to town. The dinning room has a wonderful view of the valley and the sunrise so the view breakfast is stunning.

title: beautiful property with great views
review: This old property has been well converted to a very comfortable and attractive hotel.  Whilst it is clearly in need of some extensive TLC, I will happily forgive this for the sheer pleasure of being is such beautiful surroundings.  The restaurant and spa areas are much later additions and do not suit the architecture of the original building.  However, they serve their purpose pretty well.  The rooms are varied but comfortable and quirky with a very original feel.  Well worth a visit if you want something a little different in Spain.

title: Loved the place
review: The hotel itself is as beautiful as the mountains around it. It's a relaly romantic place and I couldn't recommend it more, my partner and I loved it so much that we got married here :)  I would recommend renting a car if you're planning on staying here as it's not walking distance to the town. There's a great trail that loops around the hill next to the hotel and leads back to Antequera, takes about 1-2 hours.  The restaurant is a bit expensive but is fantastic, and you can also order food in the hotel bar which is also really good.

title: Genuine 5 star property
review: Beautiful hotel located in rural area outside antequera in beautiful rural setting.   Rooms large , spacious, nicely decorated, among the nicest I have stayed anywhere.   Great breakfast,  dinner just a bit below 5 stars.    Hotel is isolated but that is part of the charm.   Pool and spa.    Highly recommended

title: 16th Century location for quiet 19th century romance
review: Because this hotel is situated somewhat off the beaten track, it is not easy to find, by car. The navigation coordinates listed on the website of the hotel seem not to correspond with the reality. Eventually signs point you in the right direction, but even then perseverance is needed. Just when you think you are lost, you can see the hotel in the near distance perched on a hill above you. Secure private parking is available in the basement. The English speaking staff in the reception was professional, very friendly and most helpful, so it did not take long before we could take the elevator to our room. The room has a nice size with typical Spanish’ decor. There was just enough wardrobe space for two in a cupboard, which also hides a pin code operated safe, with easy operation,…

title: A little heaven on earth
review: We were looking for a quiet retreat and couldn't have chosen better. Surrounded by the Torcal rocks formation and olives you will find this convent a peaceful retreat with heated pool looking at the gardens and mountain views. There are only 21 rooms so make sure to reserve on time. The personal is very kind and helpful and the breakfast buffet Superp, try the omelette with anything you wish for, it is a hit, the bread from Antequera has a homemade taste and texture worth the try.  The restaurant has the same view as the pool.  Our room was looking to the gardens and everything was to our complete satisfaction, you will also find pool towels, cap and flip flops at the room. The chapel of the convent is used for weddings or events and in the night you may hear Gregorian songs…

title: Rural Luxury in Andalucia
review: This imposing hotel, full of history and set in the country just outside Antequera, offers luxury accommodation and fine cuisine at a really reasonable price. The Junior Suite we occupied was spacious and offered the luxury of a spa bath which, after a long day's travel, was very welcome. Dinner was of a high quality though service was slow and the meal took over two hours to complete. The breakfast buffet was, I think, the finest I have ever seen with so much choice, all fresh and tempting - very impressive. The staff were charming and helpful and the setting is stunning. Though the hotel is self-contained and has everything available including a Spa it is situated only 10 minutes from the wonderful town of Antequera. If you want a treat I recommend this hotel and I am sure…

title: Beautiful romantic setting
review: This place is totally amazing.  The rooms were all so unique and huge.  I had a room facing the huge courtyard and each morning I had the pleasure of hearing the rooster wake up the donkey (Magdaleno was his name) and then he would do his little heehaw thing!  So cute!  The views are breath taking.  It is about a ten minute drive to Antequera but perfect location for relaxing.  The day we arrived there were three weddings at the hotel.  The breakfast buffet was vast!  You could have about anything and everything, fresh fruit, cheeses and meats, fresh juice, eggs, pastries...just a beautiful spread.  The staff was extremely kind and helpful.  This place was my favorite out of my two week visit in Spain! I was traveling with a cycling group so we visited several hotels and this…

title: Stunning Retreat...
review: This hotel is tucked away in the middle of 'nowhere' with stunning views of the mountainous landscape. Formerly a convent, the hotel has very modern rooms and bathroom facilities with wifi access. Had the most amazing salmon salad at arrival and enjoyed their generous provision of toiletries, spa slippers, sewing kit, shoe polish and other thoughtful bits and pieces. Breakfast was nice with champagne for those who are that way inclined. I enjoyed my stay and hope they keep up the standards.

title: A spectacular setting in Antequera
review: The Hotel is an old convent at the foot of the Torcal national park in Antequera. The setting itself is worth it. You are surrounded by olive groves, spectacular mountain range and the only noise comes from roosters and donkeys! The restaurant is good, and breakfast excellent. Don't expect real luxurious rooms, but for the price and setting, it is a must in this area. I highly recommend it.

title: Friends wedding
review: We stayed here for 2 nights for a friends wedding. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere however the surroundings are beautiful!! The room we stayed in was lovely and clean and we had a little vegetable patch thing outside our room. The bathroom was stunning with a massive shower and lovely bath. The room was very cosy and clean, the only downside was the two twin beds that had been pushed together. Breakfast was amazing- probably one of the best we have had and the staff were so good. Only negative experience was when ordering food at the bar. It is overpriced for what it is. On the first day we ordered a chicken salad and chips. The waiter only bought over dry chicken and chips and when I queried the salad he said he would bring it over ( no apology). It took 30-40 minutes to…

title: Wonderful wedding venue
review: My son recently got married here and our entire experience was excellent. He and his future wife visited before the wedding to make arrangements as she knew of the hotel via family links in Antequera and as soon as they visited knew it was the venue for them. They were very happy with the attention to detail of the staff at all times.  Family and friends from England and Ireland as well as from Spain stayed for 3 nights. The location is amazing, very good breakfast buffet (special mention to Maria who was very friendly and helpful) I did not eat in restaurant but others did and were very happy The pool area is very nice, the rooms clean and well equipped but mostly it is the ambience and architecture that make this hotel so wonderful The actual wedding ceremony held in the…

title: Nothing Works
review: Recently stayed here as part of a Backroads Bike trip.  Worst hotel on the entire trip by far.  Our room (101 I think) was very weird, it had multiple levels, making getting your bags up and down the stair difficult, but it was not spacious. The only window in the room was 13 feet up in the air and was about 1 foot by 1 foot. Tiny, allowed in almost no light ,and there was no circulation.  Our AC broke, the toilet stopped flushing, the hairdryer broke, there was no hot water - even a little stool in the bathroom had a leg fall off. The room smelled musty - probably because there were no windows. Furniture was ancient.   Staff was . . . disinterested. Both at check in and when going to the bar, I had to wait several minutes while employees finished cellphone conversations.   The…

title: Great stay
review: we had a lovely stay at the convento after it had been recommended,  the room we were given was a suite which was a nice surprise and a great standard.  The breakfast was very good everything you'd expect and the restaurant was excellent.  the location is beautiful and ideal if you like being away from everything.  Antequera is not a far drive and is a lovely town to visit.  we relaxed at the pool area but didn't get around to using the spa facilities.  Great stay & would recommend to those who like luxury and quiet times in a beautiful setting.

title: El Torcal and the hotel
review: Certainly the hotel is not close to anything but you can use an old roman path and be in Antequera cuty in less than 45 minutes. The sorroundings areas provides the peace that you need for meditation. The spa has small issues, such as the sauna did not work properly or the cold bath has not stones for feet massage, but you can sit outside in a very incredible enviroment, fresh also on summer time. The roons are clean with all facilities, includingan hidro massage bath.

title: Lacking soul
review: There are so many things to like about this hotel. Great setting, really lovely room (junior suite), jacuzzi with an amazing view, decent food, but it just lacks a soul - which is sad seeing it is an old convent. The man on reception offered us little else than a basic check in - many other places we have stayed in Spain have sat us down, provided us a welcome drink, given us a map and shared enthusiasm about their hotel and the local area.  Not here.  We opted for half board - dinner and breakfast. Dinner was lovely in a room with a lovely view but the service was nothing special. Breakfast had a wide selection of the expected usual goodies. I enjoyed a terrific soak in the jacuzzi with a glass of wine and a wonderful out look - the highlight of my stay but even that was…

title: Could be paradise but lacks maintainance
review: Recommended for rural relaxation. The outdoor architecture and the public spaces are thrilling! You really feel the convents atmosphere. We had a big room with a "personal" garden that was very pleasant.  The hotel has all the facilities for a 5 star yet half of them are poorly maintained. It feels the places' glory has passed.   That said, the price for what wa've got was amazing and so was the mountain view breakfast.

title: My personal garden in a beautiful country setting
review: Our room faced out on our personal garden, and then over a valley and El Torcal mountain, covered in clouds the whole time we were there. I walked out of the door and picked a ripe strawberry. Very nice. We ate two breakfasts and two suppers. The breakfast was quite good: fresh rolls, cheeses, hams, fruit; you could request eggs fixed the way you wanted. Good coffee which you make yourself to your own preference.  Suppers were good, not outstanding and wines were good. This hotel is quite isolated, so if you don't want to eat there, it is probably a15-minute drive into town. I found it a very comfortable place to relax during a multi-day bicycle trip. There is a beautiful gorge below the hotel and a nicely maintained footpath, which I followed about a mile and a half along the…

title: Lovely setting but significant drawbacks!
review: The best thing about this hotel is its truly amazing location - set in an olive tree decorated hill overlooking the impressive surrounding landscape. It was breathtaking!  However, the hotel itself had some more noticeable drawbacks. It has to be said that the rooms themselves, being as we were on the lower level, were very good - beds were great, WiFi could vastly be improved though. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms clearly a focus feature. There, everything was modern and the door directly into the garden was an initially underestimated benefit. But outside the rooms the whole place itself was rather confusing. The character of the hotel, being a converted monastery, was as expected fabulous but in its hotel format there were a few problems. The set-up, through narrow…

title: Escape from reality
review: We live in Villanueva del Trabuco and visit Antequera quite often and sometimes walk to this hotel and have a coffee, and decided it would be a nice treat to stay there for the night. When it opened in March we booked a room. We were not disappointed, the room was really nice and peaceful. We paid a visit to the spa which was very relaxing and then had a good meal in the restaurant.

title: A moment to reflect ...
review: We took a suite, beautifully decorated and laid out.  Fantastic private spa bath with everything you could need for your stay.  Well stocked mini bar and a choice of pillows!   The Spa itself was clean and welcoming, I took advantage of the treatments on offer whilst my husband played 9 holes...  To top it off we had a excellent meal that evening, the breakfast was again plentiful and a vast selection of breakfast items, even champagne!  The staff were very helpful and can't wait to come back again ;)

title: A piece of Heaven
review: Firstly, use the Grid Reference supplied by the Hotel for your Satellite Navigation, or you may never find it! It is outside Antequera, up in the mountains, down a long driveway. There is only one signpost, and that is right at the entrance, so, chances are that you will drive straight past and have to turn around. The drive is narrow, twisty and unlit, so driving in the dark could be 'exciting'.  When you approach the hotel, you are greeted with a breathtaking sight of the hotel amongst the mountains, looking spectacular.  You will not believe that this is the 5 star hotel that you paid so little to stay at.  We were in Room 001 (had hoped for 007), which is at ground level, but -2 from Reception, passing the Gym, Pool, Zen Relaxation Area & Beauty parlour. These rooms all have…

title: Heavenly location, few drawbacks
review: This is a stunning location, breath-taking, which makes up for a lot. Breakfast (delicious - meats and cheeses, breads, fresh hot food if you wanted, fruit, and make your own coffee which is a bonus, keep it coming!) had a divine view across the gardens, the Hacienda and the distant hills. And the music is hilarious - at first you think it's religious, but eventually reveals itself as monks covering such luminaries as the Beatles, Robbie Williams and the Pet Shop Boys.  Our room was lovely, even though someone insisted on breaking bricks under our window from 8am.  Gorgeous spa bath, although water takes hours to run and is tepid. Shower much better. Bed(s) nice (sadly, few are doubles), aircon powerful, plenty of space for everything. One wonky cupboard door which was a pain as…

title: Beyond peaceful
review: We live in the vicinity and know the hotel very well. We book occasional nights (usually a Sunday, towards the end of each month) to really relax and unwind. The hotel is just so peaceful, the beds are amazingly comfortable and it makes a wonderful retreat, away from home. Cannot recommend it highly enough.

title: Nice 4****
review: Nice rural location, if You are looking peacfull place to stay. If you want to go to eat to town, you need a taxi. Our room was very nice, but lack of the power of the aircondition ruins the nigth. It was too hot to get good nigth sleep.July and out side temp was more than 30 degrees C. Bed was OK. The spa was small but clean. For the awerage person the sauna was too hot and dry. They should drop the temperatura to 80 degrees C. Turkis sauna was not like it should be. Bar service and check in/out was very good. This hotel is more 4 stars than 5.

title: WHAT  AN  ESCAPE !!
review: All the writing and photographs will not come close to actually being there....finding it is part of the feature.....when approaching and you see nothing other than stunning scenery with a Golf Course adjacent, you have to stop and blink for the double take. The Convent is set in an absolutely stunning location and you can actually walk to the town of Antequera approx one and a half miles, by way of a path that runs along the side of a mountain overlooking part of the golf course and several valleys which has a priceless tag for beauty.  The Convent has been superbly renovated, the facilities include a Spa, Sauna, Steam Room and Swimming Pool with a Jacuzzi style relaxer.  Staff are on hand to help,advise which also makes for a happy stay.  Sadly.......unless you experience a…

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: This hotel is just wonderful. Lovely old building, with lots of interesting and beautiful spaces to while away time. It is so peaceful. The rooms are furnished in keeping with the old building, but with very large modern bathrooms. Great Spa, which I had all to myself on both occasions I went there. The restaurant is fantastic, and not too expensive ( less than Parador prices). The service from all the staff, from reception to restaurant and bar staff was superb. Would highly recommend to anyone who wants a peaceful stay in lovely surroundings. Only 10 minutes drive from centre of Antequera, but felt like a million miles. Best breakfast I have ever had in a hotel. All hot food cooked to order.

title: Magnificant Hotel in a peaceful location
review: We stayed here two nights as part of a cycling holiday. It was pristine with some stunning aspects but we felt that it had lost a little of the authentic feel in the restoration. The public rooms were grand and the restaurant had fab views over the valley and beyond. The Restaurant food was very good too. The breakfast was excellent - it was difficult to think of what else they could do! The rooms were good with an outside area that was your own. It had the feel of being over thought - the bathroom was complicated and the shower needed an instruction booklet as it was too difficult to work out in the few days we stayed! The pool area was way too hot - better ventilation needed. This could be a great place just a few areas to think on! Service was good but a little detached.

title: Convento magdelena Antequerra april2014
review: Stayed  overnight  24/25 April 2014. Was a bit worried about earlier posts on here..... Not easy to find, quite a way outside of Antequerra, you need a car... head for Eroski supermarket on Seville road out of town. Signposted from roundabout by Antequerra Golf  hotel with statue of golfer on it. Just keep going up and up! Using our  sat nav took us on a dead end up an unmade road and had to back track down to roundabout!! Arrived  mid day,  the hotel had a very, very  busy conference day with over 200 guest for lunch, but they made us very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble to get us into our  rooms and  make sure we had drinks and snacks despite the hectic time for them. The spa &  pool were very, very clean, not too busy, but could do with a few more sunbeds or seating…

title: Needs a Five Star Overhaul
review: We booked a two night stay based on what seemed to be an excellent offer for a 5 star hotel. I must emphasise that I have been as objective as possible in this review, basing my comments on the room itself, the staff and the location.  Without being too discourteous I am obliged to say that I cannot believe that the hotel deserves a five star rating. There is no doubt that the hotel is housed in what used to be a splendid Convento and much money has been spent on its renovation. It just needs to spend a bit more money and it does need to employ staff who either have previous "five star" experience, or who have been trained to that level. That is clearly a management responsibility and needs to be addressed by management.   Perhaps my first comment sets the scene. We arrived at…

title: What a dump!
review: My first room had a rainhead shower, but no hot water. So, I was moved to another room, which had no rainhead shower, instead offering a nozzle with a fixture that had broken off the wall.
