I asked for another room and the surly, unapologetic clerk told me there were no other choices. Avoid this disaster.

title: Lovely hotel
review: We had a 2 night stay at the hotel Magdalena.  It was rather difficult to find as signs ran out travelling up the hill out of the town of Antequera which was well worth a visit for a pretty small town and lovely tapas. Beautiful surroundings and gorgeous hotel to look at.  A little tired inside and could do with some maintainence and updating in places. The spa was nice and we had to ourselves, however we were unable to use the jacuzzi as it was rather cold. Food was overpriced, Antequera itself was easy to get to for dinner and more advised. Staff were friendly and helpful. Very good for a golf hotel.

title: Average
review: Magdalena is a strange place. I wish I had stepped back in time to be reminded of the convent , instead I felt like I was in 'The Shining'. It could be amazing, but modern furniture and features have been added which means the charm has been lost.  We had a pleasant enough stay,  but there are little touches that really let it down. The air con does not work. I had to ask three times before anyone would take a look. I was told it was working, but it is a small puff at best. Be warned if going at the height of summer! Now I know it is an old convent, but it also says it is a 5 star hotel with air conditioning!    I also find that 5 star hotels don't usually have to ask guests not to remove food at breakfast or to take the bathrobes. The bathrobes were old and scraggy....so for…

title: Lovely peaceful location for a good hotel
review: This hotel is set amongst olive groves with lovely views of the surrounding countryside, just a few minutes by car from Antequera. Our Junior Suite was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel is spotlessly clean. We thoroughly enjoyed using the small spa. Breakfasts were extremely good - an enormous choice of quality food. But the hotel only rates 4 stars in my opinion. The evening meals (we eat there twice) was very limited and not the full lunchtime menu as we thought. The sun loungers were mostly falling apart and only a few available. The level of English from the staff was limited. Also, while some staff were excellent there were examples of exactly the opposite. I thought the hotel was very good in so many ways but definitely not a 5 star establishment. Recommended but…

title: Excellent Hotel in a lovely setting
review: Situated outside Antequera, this hotel is set amongst olive groves with lovely views of the surrounding countryside. We had a Junior Suite which was very spacious and comfortable. The whole hotel site is spotlessly clean. A spa is available and we thoroughly enjoyed using it. Breakfasts were very, very good - an enormous choice of quality food. Why only rating it 4, you ask? The evening meals (we eat there twice) was very limited and not the full lunchtime menu as we thought. The sun loungers were mostly falling apart and only a few available. The level of English from the staff was limited. Also, while some staff were excellent there were examples of exactly the opposite. Don't get me wrong, I thought the hotel was very good in so many ways but definitely not a 5 star…

title: Best place to rest and relax
review: Hotel location is far from the town. Not easy to get there by car if you are new to the area. From downtown to the hotel it is 15 euros by taxi.  Hotel is luxury, breakfast, service and rooms are all perfect .  Indoor swimming pool was amazing

title: Lovely relaxing hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel and found it to be a really lovely relaxing place to stay. It is quiet and understated and in a beautiful location. The breakfast was quite frankly the best I have ever seen or eaten and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Ask for directions to the pilgrim route and you can walk or cycle to antequera. A really lovely find.

title: Magnificent Convent-converted Hotel with magnificent view of mountains
review: I stayed Hotel Convento La Magdalena in June 2013 for 3 nights for holiday. It seems that the hotel is built for people staying and playing golf at the near-by golf-course. I didn't go to play golf, but enjoyed my stay.  Pros: (1) It's originally convent, and converted into a hotel. Naturally, the building is beautiful. (2) Room is pretty large, and comfortable. The rooms are nicely furnished. My room was on the ground floor and I can walk out to the garden area from my room. (3) Staff are very nice. I was pleasantly surprised that staff at the reception can speak decent English. (4) Pool (small, not for serious swimming) and the garden outside the pool is very pleasant. (5) Food is very good. So you actually don't need to go out. One day we came back very late, and the…

title: Gorgeous hotel/ staff need "motivating"
review: Positive: Great location with stunning countrysideviews, comfortable room  lovely old monastery building and the restaurant is good.  Negative: Spa area is bit tired, reception staff less than motivated given this is a 5* hotel (indifferent and unhelpful at best!)

title: Peaceful location - away from it all
review: Lovely hotel very peaceful and quiet. Well away from the main town a car is essential, not too easy to find but just follow the golf signs and its not too difficult. A fantastic rustic building full of character. Staff couldn't be more helpful, restaurant food and service superb as was the breakfast. Spa facilities were also good, overall a good stay, would certainly come back. Best option is the half board.

title: Quiet hotel with peaceful surroundings
review: Staying at the La Magdalena for two nights, half board was a pleasant experience. The hotel, ex convent, was exceptionally quiet, with only four diners in the evening. The staff were charming and helpful. Wanting to visit Torcal to see the limestone rock features and no tourist guide leaflets available, front of house manager gave excellent directions. Our room was a junior suite, which was quite large, and overlooked the front courtyard. I would have preferred a room at the back of the hotel as the views are stunning, but as our main reason for being in the area was to play golf we did not ask to change rooms. The food, both in the evening, and at breakfast could not be faulted. My only small niggle would be that it seemed a shame that the pool area was completely enclosed,…

title: Golf Accommodation
review: It was pleasure to visit Antequera , I stayed in 5 star Hotel Convento La Magdalena it is situated on  outskirts of the city of Antequera. Lots of facilities are there like good restaurants, bars and terraces. Excellent food and beverage and also golf and its accessories, pleasure to see green fees with exciting weather.

title: Amazing place,
review: if you want desconet, this will be your best choice. Locate in the mountains, with amazing views and greats activities around. Prepare yourself, it has a lot of birds, quite nice to heard them. We enjoyed a lot our stay.

title: Lovely remote hotel, away from tourist area and simply Spanish.
review: Get away from it all here. Perfect views, quiet location. Car essential. Would benefit from outdoor pool but indoor pool and small gym which was quiet at all times of day although we went early season! A couple of issues in room which were attended to immediately by very efficient staff. Would recommend if you are looking for quiet retreat in perfect location.

title: Stunning view, beautiful stay.
review: This hotel (ex convent) is located in a stunning location. Rooms are beautiful and and the food is good. People are welcoming and very nice. I am looking forward to go back. It is very close to Antequera and the park of Torcal which are both worth visiting.

title: Excellent experience
review: The hotel is a almost completely restored old convent. It is situated in the outskirt of Antequera in a stunning valley and surrounded by montains. The atmosphere is excellent and the enviroment welcoming. We ate at the hotel restaurant twice and the food is very good.  The location is also ideal for people that like outdoor activities such as trekking in natural parks (Torcal and Lobo) or cycling. I would definitely recommend it.

title: an absolute must
review: I lived very close to this hotel and would visit every week end to chill out after a weeks work, The ambiance is mind blowing , the food is amazing , and the staff are all lovely people. Then there is mark the pianist who plays in the bar who would always play my requests of jerry lee lewis. If 10 stars were available then this hotel would deserve them.

title: Stunning building. Rooms ok.
review: The hotel is not very easy to find. The road follows the golf course for a while. Being there after some heavy storms, the road was in a very bad condition and the small bridge over the torrent before the hotel had collapsed on half its width! Yet arrival at the parking lot was just amazing. This convent, what a building! The lobby and main reception room, a chapel, are equally impressive. The room was ok though we had to take an unfriendly elevator serving the kitchen as well. Did not try the food but prices were high for the region. Advice: use the road from the North through the olive trees rather than the South road along the golf course. Quicker and more scenic.

title: Quirky!
review: We have been coming here since it first opened and have fallen in love with the place.  Yes, it has problems but we always seem to be able to forgive them.  We have had terrible meals here but it is improving.  We have had water pouring in the windows whilst there has been none coming out of the shower!  The value for money is astounding with the golf package.  It is not a 5 star by most peoples standard but we adore it.  The surroundings are beautiful, the building is sublime.  Come here with an open mind and you will love it

title: Slightly bizarre
review: We booked to play golf on a good deal from Sunshine Golf.  The recent floods meant that the course was not at its best and the hotel is not really on the course, it's about 5 mins drive away and you can't see the course from the hotel despite the website giving you (at least me) the impression that the hotel was next to the course.  How this hotel survives is a mystery. Only 9 guests were there when we were there and we were outnumbered by staff who are fine - but must be bored as what is there to do all day? We only had breakfast as the place lacked life with so few guests and strange Enya type music played most of the time. No pool available due to repairs.  Had more of the feel of a retirement home about it than anything else, they need desperately to get more guests but…

title: A pleasant stay just mins from our house in Andalucia
review: It is marketed as a 5 star hotel, and it is in many ways....  but could have a few improvements, on the food, very promising start - we had the lunch de luxe option which is pretty dear for the area at 45 euros pp. It began very nicely, we had an appetizer of jamon serano with a topping of a quail's egg on their lovely light crackers. Next a smoked salmon starter which was delicious. We had a special of the area which is a layered apple, goats cheese and pate in the form of a terrine, yum, one of my favs. Then, octopus and potato with tiny shrimps but it was so salty, it overpowered the dish. The cod was truly awful...it smelled rather off! We ended on secreto of pork which again was good but so oversalted. With wine and coffee 107 euros, so far from cheap. In truth I think the…

title: Please stop the music!
review: This lovely hotel in a labyrinthine old convent in the countryside near Antequera should be a haven of peace and tranquility, but it certainly wasn't that when we stayed.  In the large esplanade in front of the hotel we were greeted by music blaring out from speakers mounted on the outside wall facing towards the hotel.  What music best suits Andalucia on a hot summer afternoon? You've got it in one: American big bands from the 1940's, often fronted by a loud singer. This started before breakfast and went on until almost midnight.  And there was no escape, it was everywhere, even on the terrace restaurant for al fresco dinner.  What a pity and what a relief at dinner when the music finally stopped towards midnight.           Apart from the music everything else was excellent. …

title: Best in Andalucia
review: If you are looking for a quiet and relaxing vacation, this is the place. The building is an old monastery renovated for comfort and spacious hotel rooms. Excellent value for money. Surrounded by golf course, the whole place is so quiet you would sure feel like your are in a real monaster. However, if you are looking for action, this is not a place. Quite far from town, you would not find any meaningful activity around the hotel except for golf.

title: No complaints
review: stayed one night as needed a place close  to Malaga airport and the price offered seemed to good to pass up. It is certainly out of Antequera and it definitely needs a car to reach. Location was not a problem for us on this visit. IT is very well -signposted. The building was very striking, especially the interior cloisters and chapel area which appeared to have many original inscriptions. But the rooms must be an upgrade on what the nuns were provided with. Restaurant looks over open country and provided excellent evening meal and extensive buffet. Very helpful Spanish waiter despite his limited English was witty and attentive. Other staff we met also gave excellent service. We did not have enough time to sample all the breakfast. Would certainly recommend this hotel even if…

title: Best Golf and Hotel Deal in Spain
review: I was recommended this deal - 1 round of golf at Antequera Golf and one nights B&B at the Hotel Convento de la Magdalena - by Sunshine Golf in La Cala de Mijas for 64 Euro per person Sunday to Thursday. This is definitely the best golf deal in Spain. We arrived on Monday 16th April at the hotel around 1230pm and were checked in immediately (thought this was great as most hotels won't let you in until 4pm). We played golf at 2pm and then went back to the hotel for a swim a drink and then dinner. The service was superb lead by the maitre d and his team and the food was fantastic!! The next morning breakfast was again brilliant with an amazing choice from cereal to cole meats to hot cooked food. The bedrooms were of a very high standard as you would expect from a 5* hotel. Loved…

title: Lovely
review: We were invited to stay for 5 days for a friends wedding. The hotel and grounds were beautiful. The food was lovely, especially the food at the wedding itself. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A few improvements could be made- our room really smelled of damp when we first arrived- not sure if its a good thing or not, but you got used to it!? and they need to change the music that is played outside, maybe add a few more tracks to the cd! I know they have not been open that long so are still working on projects in and around the hotel.... but they really need to get that outdoor pool done! A great break and a lovely wedding!

title: Nightmare
review: Had a one night stay at this hotel which is definitely NOT a 5 star.  A beautiful setting is the last of the good news.  It is understaffed, miles from anywhere and the food is awful, microwaved garbage.  The staff that are there are nice people but are constantly apologising for a lack of knowledge and ability.  Should have realised from the price that it was not going to be top class but other people on this site made it sound quite good.  Perhaps they went to a different place to me!!!!

title: Beautiful location & building but lacking warmth
review: Did an overnight treat in a suite. The room was nice enough but nothing special. There were a few areas where maintenance was needed and it could have been a bit cleaner (fluff under the bedsides tables etc...) The hotel was pretty empty and therefore didn't seem to be fully staffed. We waited ages to be served at the bar - my husband gad to go and find a waiter from the restaurant. The spa (which was the reason for staying here) was also in need of an upgrade. Missing tiles in the pool, pain flaking off the walls, no therapists present...shame as we fancied a massage. The restaurant was OK but I was disappointed when the waiter said that the chef could only make a risotto for 2 people minimum - it didn't state this on the menu.  In summary - expensive at Euro 150 per night and…

title: Lovely hotel spoilt by piped music, flashing lights and poor information
review: Our stay at this splendidly located and restored convent was spoilt by incesssant piped music outside and in some areas inside the hotel. Also impossible to 'blank out'. was a continuously flashing red light from the smoke detector above the beds, and a blue ligh in the hallway that reflects on to the beds from a mirror. The  information booklet describes 7 pillow fillings that are available, but does not explain the unconventional controls for the bath or shower, or how to access english-speaking channels on the TV. Nor does it mention the delightful 5 or so km.pathway to Antequera. Piped music is availalable in the bathrooms but the shower appeared to provide only hot to very hot water: no warm or cold There is no clock in the bedrooms, or incredibly even in the vicinity of…

title: Excellent experience
review: The hotel is situated in a lovely place, far from everything. Great meal - try the Millefoile foie and the Sea brass. There is a donkey called Magdalena, try to ring the Convento bell, he will come :).

title: location,location,location, NOT! but excellent otw.
review: Located about 5 miles west of Antequerra, an old but unremarkable city, this is a renovated old convent in a great location for daytripping to Granada, Cordova and other sites around. The setting is remarkably pretty, pastoral with surrounding hills covered with olive groves.  The facility is a huge building with a gym,sauna,steam room and pool. It has a bar where lighter fare can be eaten and a formal diningroom, very large, with plate glass windows on the west side overlooking the hills. The food in both  places is passable and not terribly expensive. A very complete breakfast buffet is available with someone there to cook a hot breakfast for you. All service throughout the hotel was cheerful, friendly and most efficient. The reception staff all speak very good English and are…

title: Excellent hotel
review: We held our daughters wedding celebrations at the hotel over the weekend of 1 October. The setting of the hotel is stunning in the Andulucian countryside just outside the very attractive town of Antequeria away from the tourist  areas.   The accommodation was excellent, the food outstanding and the staff could not have been more helpful. The guests stayed in the hotel and its sister hotel the Golf. This part of Spain is still very reasonably priced-a place to be recommended whether for a meal, holiday or party.

title: Perfect for a relaxing holiday
review: A lovely, comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff and great food. The perfect  get-away retreat surrounded by olive groves and mountains. Highly recommend a junior suite with its own terrace - well worth paying a bit extra. The pool was perfect and very quiet, and relaxing after a jacuzzi on the lawn was idyllic. You do get moved out on a Saturday night to the sister hotel in town if there's a wedding, but this was well organised, even though the other hotel (Antequerra Golf) was far too busy for our liking. If you want peace and quiet, away from it all, then this is the place to go.

title: Great!
review: A wonderful place to relax!  The hotel is beautiful, with a very nice and complete SPA area, and the surrounding grounds with olive trees are gorgeous.  The breakfast was AMAZING and the service outstanding. Would come back anytime!

title: NOT 5 STAR!!
review: At arriving at the hotel after travelling 12 hours we were told there was no room service available at 11.30pm in a 5 star hotel. there was excrement on the floor in my room, the fridge did not work, there was a wasps nest on my terrace, my bath tap was broken,the running machine was broken, as was the steam room, there was no outside pool, the spa was filthy dirty, we were served raw chicken 3 times at dinner. absolutely poor management in fact through complaining the whole time the manager never actually turned up once, beautiful building with potential very badly ran none of my grievances were taken care of

title: This Hotel is worth a trip to Spain!
review: We have stayed in this hotel for just two days and regret we could not stay longer.  The hotel is an ancient monastery which has been recently renovated and converted into a hotel, located in an extremely quiet area surrounded by a golf course.  You can taste the history of the place enjoying an excellent service at the same time.  The town of Antequera is just a few km away.  The restaurant is superb, closed by a window with a stunning view on the valley.  The food is very good, and the service excellent.  I would strongly recommend it.

title: This really is value for money!
review: 169 euros each for 3 nights B&B and 3 rounds of golf is astounding in itself...but I also have a suite and the most gorgeous room, ever. Food is 5 star, service is fantastic. With only 21 rooms it is quiet, but I like that! Have explored most of the convent, my fave o far has to be the little stairwell into the catacombs...off for. Gin and some more exploring!!

title: Stunning Location, Superb hotel
review: We stayed at La Magdelena with a group of twelve friends for six days. The rooms and spa facilities were excellent.The rooms were  extremely well appointed with excellent complimentaries,robes and slippers. The only downside is that the rooms do not have any tea or coffee facilities as we already knew this most of the group brought travel kettles. Each evening apart from one we had superb service and food in the stunning panoramic dining room, on the one occassion when the service and food was poor the evening was salvaged by Fredricko who was excellent and even furnished the whole group with complementary cocktails. We played golf at Antequera and received excellent attention from the professional Karl Adams. The course is not easy but enjoyable and was in good condition. We…

title: A splendid hotel and experience
review: I stayed only 1 night at the convento la magdalena with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday. It was the perfect choice! A special offer for september meant that  our stunning  double bedroom, buffet breakfast and spa came to 90 euros  for both of us..... which for a 5 star hotel was incredible good value for money.Courteous staff, large, clean and luxurious rooms and bathrooms, a well maintained spa and a stunning breakfast display, I cannot praise this hotel enough. It gave  us a  chance to  experience 5 star  accommodation which we normally can't afford!  It is  quite isolated, so you will need a car to travel to Antequera and there is nothing else around in the immediate vicinity.. but  we were quite happy to stay at the hotel and enjoy the spa area and eat at the hotel's…

title: Poor quality food and service
review: We went to try the hotel's restaurant on a recommendation.  The place looks to have a stunning setting, but we struggled to find the restaurant. It appeared that we had to dine outside, and could only choose from a very limited menu, all of which was prepared on a barbecue. No other dining options were given. The staff seemed friendly, but were a bit lacking in their attention, had to ask for the wine list a few times. We chose a pretty expensive bottle as a treat, which the waiter brought to our table, shook it about quite a bit while opening, then, when poured, unceremoniously  plonked the cork back in and put it on the table. We were expecting a little bit more care and attention from a 5-star location. Similarly, we thought that bigger glasses would be provided for us to…

title: Hotel closed without notification
review: Arrived, with my 90 year old father for a stay over Christmas. Hotel door was locked and I was made to stay in pouring rain whilst I insisted to reception, through intercom, that I had a reservation. My father fell over entrance steps in dark and bruised his arm. When we eventually were allowed in we were told they thought we were intruders (!) and then a series of lies, including  that they didn't have a reservation for us and that the hotel was full. In fact the hotel was empty and there were no staff. I showed them proof of booking and insisted on having a room as it was 1.30 in the morning. Woken at 2.45 by manager of sister hotel, telling us to go there. We refused to move in the middle of night. Woken by deliberately banging doors and loud music pumped into our room at…

title: A magnificent experience in a stately building steeped in history
review: We were treated like royalty from arrival to departure. Every member of staff we met was friendly, polite and helpful and spoke English. We were given a suite with two bedrooms, lounge, dining room and sitting room. The whole place was spotless, the bedrooms were roomy and comfortable. The dining had superb views over the mountain valleys. The food was excellent and service first class. Plenty of choice and a good wine list. Prices were very reasonable - more in keeping with a four star hotel. We paid €75 (Euro) ppp night for dinner, bed and breakfast. The hotel is isolated in the mountain side but only five minutes drive to Antiquera. The only downside for us was that there was no tea/coffee making facilty in the bedrooms but then that is probably the same in most Spanish…

title: If you like peace, this is the place
review: Arrived on Tuesday 8th Sept, booked for six nights. Excellent reception. Pleasant and charming. Immediately apologised and said that unfortunately on Saturday night the hotel had been booked for a wedding and three hundred people were expected. We were welcome to stay but there was going to be a band playing all night and we probably wouldn't get much sleep. They had booked us into their sister hotel the Antequera Golf and in compensation upgraded us to a suite. Having stayed in Paradors all over Spain and on several occasions having the same problem with weddings, never have we been compensated in any way but been left to lump it, this was pretty good. The room we had in the Convent had a view towards the tennis court. But no problem only had to ask, given room next door with…

title: A pretty place
review: This is a very nice hotel. I would recommend it to relax for a few days. It is far from Antequera town center, so it is not the best option to visit the town. However, the hotel facilities are good and modern, with the asset of this being a historic building. Great spa, with nice views of the mountains from the swimming pool. We had dinner at the barbecue restaurant. I was surprised by the good prices for a 5* hotel. The food was good and the service attentive. The only problem we had during our stay that it took the waiters at the restaurant more than 30 minutes to bring us the check after we requested it. We asked for it several times but they failed to comply. My recommendation to the management is that they should improve the organization of the restaurant. Other than that,…

title: outstanding hotel
review: I stayed here for one night and as i pulled around the corner to see the Hotel in the distance for the firdt time, i was blown away! it is the most stunning view. And i was not disappointed once i walked into the reception. The staff are ALL amazing, they do not know the word "NO" and went out of thier way on every occasion to deliver the WOW to us during our stay. We stayed in the biggest suite in the Hotel which had two main bedrooms, a hugeliving area with three dining areas. The rooms are amazing and the overall cleanlinessand comfort is second to none. The actual hotel is so beautiful you do not want to leave. We also had breakfast which was lovely.Overal the most amazing place to stay.
